#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=XIII
#Text=It had never before occurred to him that she might , after all , have missed the purport of the document he had put in her way .
#Text=What if , in her hurried inspection of the papers , she had passed it over as related to the private business of some client ?
#Text=What , for instance , was to prevent her concluding that Glennard was the counsel of the unknown person who had sold the “ Aubyn Letters . ”
#Text=The subject was one not likely to fix her attention -- she was not a curious woman .
#Text=Glennard at this point laid down his fork and glanced at her between the candle-shades .
#Text=The alternative explanation of her indifference was not slow in presenting itself .
#Text=Her head had the same listening droop as when he had caught sight of her the day before in Flamel ’s company ; the attitude revived the vividness of his impression .
#Text=It was simple enough , after all .
#Text=She had ceased to care for him because she cared for someone else .
#Text=As he followed her upstairs he felt a sudden stirring of his dormant anger .
#Text=His sentiments had lost all their factitious complexity .
#Text=He had already acquitted her of any connivance in his baseness , and he felt only that he loved her and that she had escaped him .

#Text=This was now , strangely enough , his dominating thought : the consciousness that he and she had passed through the fusion of love and had emerged from it as incommunicably apart as though the transmutation had never taken place .
#Text=Every other passion , he mused , left some mark upon the nature ; but love passed like the flight of a ship across the waters .
#Text=She sank into her usual seat near the lamp , and he leaned against the chimney , moving about with an inattentive hand the knick-knacks on the mantel .
#Text=Suddenly he caught sight of her reflection in the mirror .
#Text=She was looking at him .
#Text=He turned and their eyes met .
#Text=He moved across the room and stood before her .
#Text=“ There ’s something that I want to say to you , ” he began in a low tone .
#Text=She held his gaze , but her color deepened .
#Text=He noticed again , with a jealous pang , how her beauty had gained in warmth and meaning .
#Text=It was as though a transparent cup had been filled with wine .
#Text=He looked at her ironically .
#Text=“ I ’ve never prevented your seeing your friends here , ” he broke out .
#Text=“ Why do you meet Flamel in out-of-the-way places ?
#Text=Nothing makes a woman so cheap -- ”
#Text=She rose abruptly and they faced each other a few feet apart .
#Text=“ What do you mean ? ” she asked .
#Text=“ I saw you with him last Sunday on the Riverside Drive , ” he went on , the utterance of the charge reviving his anger .
#Text=“ Ah , ” she murmured .
#Text=She sank into her chair again and began to play with a paper-knife that lay on the table at her elbow .
#Text=Her silence exasperated him .
#Text=“ Well ? ” he burst out .
#Text=“ Is that all you have to say ? ”
#Text=“ Do you wish me to explain ? ” she asked , proudly .
#Text=“ Do you imply I have n’t the right to ? ”
#Text=“ I imply nothing .
#Text=I will tell you whatever you wish to know .
#Text=I went for a walk with Mr. Flamel because he asked me to . ”
#Text=“ I did n’t suppose you went uninvited .
#Text=But there are certain things a sensible woman does n’t do .
#Text=She does n’t slink about in out-of-the-way streets with men .
#Text=Why could n’t you have seen him here ? ”
#Text=She hesitated .
#Text=“ Because he wanted to see me alone . ”
#Text=“ Did he , indeed ?
#Text=And may I ask if you gratify all his wishes with equal alacrity ? ”
#Text=“ I do n’t know that he has any others where I am concerned . ”
#Text=She paused again and then continued , in a lower voice that somehow had an under-note of warning .
#Text=“ He wished to bid me good-by .
#Text=He ’s going away . ”
#Text=Glennard turned on her a startled glance .
#Text=“ Going away ? ”
#Text=“ He ’s going to Europe to-morrow .
#Text=He goes for a long time .
#Text=I supposed you knew . ”
#Text=The last phrase revived his irritation .
#Text=“ You forget that I depend on you for my information about Flamel .
#Text=He ’s your friend and not mine .
#Text=In fact , I ’ve sometimes wondered at your going out of your way to be so civil to him when you must see plainly enough that I do n’t like him . ”
#Text=Her answer to this was not immediate .
#Text=She seemed to be choosing her words with care , not so much for her own sake as for his , and his exasperation was increased by the suspicion that she was trying to spare him .
#Text=“ He was your friend before he was mine .
#Text=I never knew him till I was married .
#Text=It was you who brought him to the house and who seemed to wish me to like him . ”
#Text=Glennard gave a short laugh .
#Text=The defence was feebler than he had expected : she was certainly not a clever woman .
#Text=“ Your deference to my wishes is really beautiful ; but it ’s not the first time in history that a man has made a mistake in introducing his friends to his wife .
#Text=You must , at any rate , have seen since then that my enthusiasm had cooled ; but so , perhaps , has your eagerness to oblige me . ”
#Text=She met this with a silence that seemed to rob the taunt of half its efficacy .
#Text=“ Is that what you imply ? ” he pressed her .
#Text=“ No , ” she answered with sudden directness . “ I noticed some time ago that you seemed to dislike him , but since then -- ”
